item.title: Jeff add a quote by Mario Vargas-Llosa
item.description: "Writers are the exorcists of their own demons." -- Mario Vargas-Llosa

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Philip Larkin
item.description: "I can't understand these chaps who go round American universities explaining how they write poems: It's like going round explaining how you sleep with your wife." -- Philip Larkin

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "If I had a flower for every time I thought of you...I could walk through my garden forever." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Jeff add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey
